document.heading: Namibia Sanctions Repeal Amendment Act of 1992

history.narrative: Law 9-127, the “Namibia Sanctions Repeal Amendment Act of 1992,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 9-361, which was referred to the Committee on Consumer and Regulatory Affairs. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on April 7, 1992, and May 6, 1992, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on May 28, 1992, it was assigned Act No. 9-211 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 9-127 became effective on July 22, 1992.

LAW 9-127 "Namibia Sanctions Repeal Amendment Act of 1992 Pursuant to Section 412 of the District of Columbia Self- Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, P. L. 93-198 the Act the Council of the District of Columbia adopted Bill No. 9-361 on first and second readings, April 7, 1992, and May 6, 1992, respectively. Following the signature of the Mayor on May 28, 1992, this legislation was assigned Act No. 9-211, published in the June 5, 1992, edition of the D.C. Register Vol. 39 page 3828) and transmitted to Congress on May 29, 1992 for a 30-day review, in accordance with Section 602(c)(i) of the Act. The Council of the District of Columbia hereby gives notice that theF~ 30-day Congressional Review Period has expired, and therefore, cites this enactment as D.C. Law 9-127, effective July 22, 1992. ¯ N cil Dates Counted During the 30-~ayfongressional Review Period: May 29 June 1,2,3,4,5,8,9,10,11,12,15,16,17,18,19,22,23,24,25,26, 29,30 July 1,2,7,8,9,20,21 Enrolled Original AN ACT D,C. ACT 9-211 Codification District of Columbia Code Supplement) IN THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA MAY 28, 1992 To amend the District of Columbia Depository Act of 1977, the District of Columbia Housing Finance Agency Act, the District of Columbia Retirement Reform Act, the Prohibition of the Investment of Public l~unds in Financial Institutions and Companies Making Loans to or Doing Business with the Republic of South Africa or Namibia Act of 1983, and the District of Columbia Procurement Practices Act of 1985 to remove Namibia from the prohibitions and restrictions imposed by the Prohibition of the Investment of Public Funds in Financial Institutions and Companies Making Loans to or Doing Business with the Republic of South Africa or Namibia Act of 1983 and the South Africa and Namibia Contracting Sanction Amendment Act of 1986. BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Namibia Sanctions Repeal Amendment Act of 1992" Sec. 2. Section 3(c) of the District of Columbia Depository Act of 1977, effective October 26, 1977 (D.C. Law 2-321 D.C. Code §47-342(c is amended by striking the phrases B) to Namibia and "or Namibia" wherever they appear, except when used in the title of the Prohibition of the Investment of Public Funds in Financial Institutions and Companies Making Loans to or Doing Business with the Republic of South Africa or Namibia Act of 1983. Sec. 3. Section 412 of the District of Columbia Housing Finance Agency Act, effective March 8, 1984 (D.C. Law 5-50; D.C. Code §45-2142 is amended by striking the phrases B) to Namibia and "or Namibia" wherever they appear, except when used in the title of the Prohibition of the Investment of Public Funds in Financial Institutions and Companies Making Loans to or Doing Business with the Republic of South Africa or Namibia Act of 1983. Sec. 4. Section 141(a)(5) of the District of Columbia Retirement Reform Act, approved November 17, 1979 (93 Star. 866; D.C. Code §1-721(a)(5 is amended by striking the phrases ii) to Namibia and "or Namibia" wherever they appear, except when used in the title of the Prohibition of the Investment of Public Funds in Financial Section 47-342 Section 45-2142 Section 1-721 Enrolled Original Institutions and Companies Making Loans to or Doing Business with the Republic of South Africa or Namibia Act of 1983. Sec. 5. Section 5 of the Prohibition of the Investment of Public Funds in Financial Institutions and Companies Making Loans to or Doing Business with the Republic of South Africa or Namibia Act of 1983, effective March 8, 1984 (D.C. Law 5-50; D.C. Code §47-139 is amended by striking the phrase "or Namibia See. 6. The District of Columbia Procurement Practices Act of 1985, effective February 21, 1986 (D.C. Law 6-85; D.C. Code §1-1181.1 e£ seq is amended as follows a) Title Xa is amended by striking the phrase "AND NAMIBIA b) Section 1002a (D.C. Code §1-1192.2) is amended by striking the phrase "or Namibia" wherever it appears, except when used in the title of the Prohibition of the Investment of Public Funds in Financial Institutions and Companies Making Loans to or Doing Business with the Republic of South Africa or Namibia Act of 1983 c) Section 1003a (D.C. Code §1-1192.3) is amended by striking the phrase "or Namibia" wherever it appears d) Section 1004a (D.C. Code §1-1192.4) is amended by striking the phrase "or Namibia" wherever it appears e) Section 1005a (D.C. Code §1-1192.5) is amended by striking the phrase "or Namibia" wherever it appears. Sec. 7. This act shall take effect after a 30-day period of Congressional review following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council of the District of Columbia to override the veto) as provided in section 602(c)(1) of the District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 813; D.C. Code §1-233(c)(1 and publication in either the District of Columbia Register, the District of Columbia Statutes-at-Large, or the District of Columbia Municipal Regulations.
